intro: Haplopappus carthamoides subsp. cusickii, commonly known as the Cusick's hairycup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
